content.title: Intramural Hematoma (IMH)
content.description: Acute aortic syndrome characterized by hemorrhage within the aortic wall without intimal tear or false lumen, representing variant of aortic dissection.

pathophysiology.mechanism: Rupture of vasa vasorum into aortic media
pathophysiology.result: Crescentic or circumferential wall thickening without flow
pathophysiology.relationship: May evolve to classic dissection, PAU, or resolve

imaging_features.cta: Crescentic high-attenuation thickening of aortic wall, no intimal flap or false lumen flow

management.type_A_imh: Surgery generally recommended (controversial, some medical management)
management.indicators_for_intervention: Progression, ascending involvement, symptoms, max thickness >11mm
